ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: if interested in philosophy, take this class, the Professors have a great collection of readings.

I would recommend this course to any student interested in the intersection of literature and politics, or literature and moral philosophy. Although it is heavily geared toward so-called "political philosophy" texts, the syllabus includes a number of works of imaginative literature. I was pleased that the class discussions of these texts went well beyond the standard post-colonial readings one might expect to find in a course cross-listed with the political science department. This class demonstrates better than most, perhaps, the benefits of interdisciplinary discourse.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
